alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 3:42AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan, eastern Bell, east central Knox and southern Clay Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 342 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Field, or 9 miles northeast of Pineville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beverly around 345 AM EDT. Stony Fork Junction, Callaway and Kettle Island around 350 AM EDT. Molus, Blackmont, Coldiron, Tacky Town, Balkan, Miracle, Oaks and Varilla around 355 AM EDT. Wallins Creek, Pathfork, Black Snake, Tremont and Cubage around 400 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kentenia, White Star, Teetersville, Elcomb, Tway, Hensley Store, Liggett, Mary Alice, Grays Knob, Martins Fork, Peepace Store, Smith, Martins Fork Lake, Three Point and Bobs Creek. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 11 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
